slides.title: Welcome to Sustainability
slides.content:
# Introduction to Sustainability

Welcome to **Sustainability** - living within limits!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Definition** - What sustainability means
- **Three Pillars** - Environment, economy, society
- **SDGs** - Global goals
- **Actions** - What you can do

> **Fun Fact:** We need 1.7 Earths to sustain current consumption!

slides.title: Concepts
slides.content:
# Sustainability Concepts

## Definition:
Meeting present needs without compromising future generations.

## Three Pillars:

| Pillar | Focus |
|--------|-------|
| Environmental | Ecosystems, resources |
| Economic | Prosperity, jobs |
| Social | Equity, health, education |

## All three must be balanced.

## Ecological Footprint:
- Resources consumed
- Waste generated
- Measured in global hectares

slides.title: SDGs
slides.content:
# Sustainable Development Goals

## 17 Goals by UN (2015-2030):

**People:**
1. No Poverty
2. Zero Hunger
3. Good Health
4. Quality Education
5. Gender Equality

**Planet:**
6. Clean Water
7. Affordable Energy
12. Responsible Consumption
13. Climate Action
14. Life Below Water
15. Life on Land

**Prosperity:**
8. Decent Work
9. Industry Innovation
10. Reduced Inequalities
11. Sustainable Cities

**Peace + Partnership:**
16. Peace and Justice
17. Partnerships

slides.title: Actions
slides.content:
# Sustainable Actions

## Individual:
- Reduce, reuse, recycle
- Energy efficiency
- Sustainable transportation
- Conscious consumption
- Plant-rich diet

## Business:
- Life cycle assessment
- Green supply chains
- Circular economy
- Corporate responsibility

## Government:
- Environmental regulations
- Renewable energy policy
- Sustainable infrastructure
- International agreements

## Circular Economy:
- Design out waste
- Keep products in use
- Regenerate natural systems

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Sustainability Summary

## Definition:
- Meet present needs
- Don't compromise future

## Three Pillars:
- Environment, Economy, Society

## SDGs:
- 17 goals for 2030
- Global cooperation needed

## Action Levels:
| Level | Examples |
|-------|----------|
| Individual | Reduce waste |
| Business | Circular economy |
| Government | Policy, regulation |

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Sustainability!
